Posts.Content: Hi I have also had immediate reconstruction by DIEP. A diep does NOT use tummy muscles just tummy fat. But, it is a good question to ask and let the surgeon explain so you the info from the expert. A diep is a long surgery and a longish recovery. I was bent double for quite a while and for the first week had quite a lot of back pain from shuffling around. So try to avoid that too much. There is also no denying the very long scar hip to hip but mine has faded and is hidden under underwear (and I don’t use Granny knickers) and bikini bottoms. The flat tummy is an add on advantage!! The new boob is very natural looking.  When I went for my consultation re surgery, I found a long list of useful questions on line to ask re diep plus I added some of my own. I then just handed the list to the surgeon and he went through them one by one and wrote down things for me.  A deip is considered the Gold Standard of reconstruction and if you can have immediate reconstruction it is the best way to go. However, although some ladies have fast recoveries sometimes recovery is much slower than other methods due to the huge abdominal surgery. But, it is doable and certainly worth it. hope this helps. Good luckxxxxxx
Posts.Title: reconstruction diep, tram or ld

Posts.Content: Hi My diep was text book but it knocked me out for ages. Tricky.....Xxxxx
Posts.Title: DIEP

Posts.Content: I had exact diagnosis as you high grade DCIS that was just under 5cm long so mastectomy on left side required. I had immediate reconstruction by DEIP as had a bit of tummy fat to use.  I did not want to go flat or have to use a prosthesis.  The only direct question I can answer is in the future I think you only have a mammogram your remaining original boob as you don’t have any breast tissue to mammogram on the reconstructed side. The good side will be done yearly. I had my op just before Xmas and have already been sent a mammogram appointment for mid December 2018.  Good luck in choosing the right option for you. There is so much to take in and in a short amount of time. I hope somebody on here can give you some info on the other questions.
Posts.Title: Struggling to decide about reconstruction

Posts.Content: Once there’s a plan in place you will feel things are going forward. Having a straight mastectomy  will happen quite quickly and most likely done day surgery. It’s a stressful time deciding which way to go. Xxxxx
Posts.Title: Struggling to decide about reconstruction

Posts.Content: Being told you have some kind of breast cancer is very frightening and scary. It is normal to feel like this. But, wait for all of the results of the tests as the size of the affected area etc is important to how they will propose to treat it. They are the experts. Having said that I was told if I automatically wanted a mastectomy they would just do it. The waiting for results is the worst as your mind goes into overdrive.Xxx
Posts.Title: Early cancer plus cancer plus 1 x lymph node treatment— lumpectomy...

Posts.Content: I had a c section 16 years ago and had a successful deip.... have the plastic surgeons said you definitely can’t use your tummy fat due to the previous surgery. If so, that’s a shame. They can use tissue from inner thighs and lower bottom. I asked about this as they can only do a deip from tummy once only.
Posts.Title: Early cancer plus cancer plus 1 x lymph node treatment— lumpectomy...

Posts.Content: Hi If you are having an immediate DIEP I would say at least 6 weeks if not longer. Obviously it depends on what kind of work you do if you have to do a 'London style Southern Region' (terrible train company even when they are not on strike over who opens the doors) commute and your age etc etc.
Posts.Title: Time frames

Posts.Content: I have experienced a lot of tightness in the stomach area. Also tenderness where if a touch certain points it's very tender and can make me jump. I mentioned it to my surgeon and on examining me said there wasn't anything wrong but thought it was tissue still settling after surgery. However, I am only just over 3 months post op not 4 years. XXXxxxx
Posts.Title: discomfort from reconstruction 4 years later

Posts.Content: Glad it all went well. Doing nothing and being pampered for a few days will do you a world of good. Take it easy and look after yourself.XXX
Posts.Title: Had my op

Posts.Content: I hope all goes well for you tomorrow, the not knowing and fearing the worst drives you crazy. I hope they find out what’s going on..... good luck and best wishes.
Posts.Title: Appointment tomorrow... Bit Nervy

Posts.Content: Hi I can't speak for what other teams do but the cosmetic surgeons I had seem to do it this way. A deip is around a 5-7 hours (sometimes much longer) operation it's complicated and clever micro surgery much bigger operation than having an implant. Also, I was told they have to let the new tissue settle to see the final outcome before they adjust the other to match. So, if your team does it this way then yes you will have to wait for a reduction. This was one of the questions I asked at my pre surgery consultations before I made up my mind to go ahead. You should talk to the surgeon before hand as to how they usually deal with this. They will also talk to you about your previous surgery as depending on exactly what you have had done it may mean you won't be able to have a diep. Not everyone is able and then they will advise the best option for you. Before you make any decisions the surgeons will advise you of your options and explain everything to you. A deip is complex specialist surgery and not done at every hospital - that say a lot!!!!! Hope this helps.XXXXXXxx
Posts.Title: Reducing the other side?

Posts.Content: Hi I have had mastectomy and immediate reconstruction by diep to one side due to DCIS. What they seem to do is do the mastectomy and reconstruction in one op then they reassess the look of the reconstruction after everything has settled, usually 3-4 months later and then tweak. That means either fiddling around by lipo modelling to new boob to make the shape better, which is what I had done plus nipple reconstruction or/and offer reduction on the other side if needed. When I was having my tweaking done there was a lovely lady who was having surgery before me who was having breast reduction to match the other side after a diep. I think they like to wait to see the outcome of the first big op before they start to cosmetically balance. Mastectomy and immediate diep surgery is a big enough operation in itself to go through without adding to it. Also, and it happens very very rarely (I was told around 2% chance) that the new boob tissue could fail. But, you will be offered it but it is done in stages. XXXXXxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Reducing the other side?

Posts.Content: Also, I meant to say that even though I have had my new boob tweaked via lipo modelling, I was told they may need to do it again as they said they do it a little at a time to try to obtain the best outcome. Have a good chat with your surgeon  but if you are able a diep gives a great natural looking new boob that will age with you. Good luck!!! Xxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Reducing the other side?

Posts.Content: It’s good to get these decisions out of the way and get on with the treatment. It will be Xmas on the sofa with a V pillow but at least the worst will be over. Good luck you will soon be out the other side.Xxxxxx
Posts.Title: Reducing the other side?

Posts.Content: I can’t believe how selfish your son is behaving. I’m so sorry it must be very hard for you. Don’t go round or ring after the appointment just book a nice holiday and put yourself first. You deserve it from reading about what you are going through. If you feel strongly about your treatment plan and know the consequences of coming off some of the drugs, then stick to your guns and do what you feel is best for you. You’re the important one in all this.
Posts.Title: Bit Scared and a Lot Angry

Posts.Content: I had the same problem. Sleeping with V pillow and lots of pillows at back and then more under my knees. After second night I took away the V pillow and then started reducing the back pillows. It is difficult...... but it gets better very soon. The recliner chair sounds a good idea. If it works for you go with it as it won't be for long. But, in the meantime be as comfy as you possibly can.
Posts.Title: How do you sleep at home after surgery?

Posts.Content: Hi I’m really sorry that you have to be here but it’s a great site for info and support. You have had some really good info and advice from the others. I was diagnosed with 4.5 cm of high grade DCIS last year and has a mastectomy and immediate reconstruction by DIEP just before Xmas. I went through all sorts of emotions prior to surgery, trying to work out the best option and then I was terrified about the surgery. It is all such a lot to take in at once. My op went very smoothly. I was hospital 4 days but at home recovery was slow. So long as you have your pain relief to hand it’s fine but I couldn’t stand up straight for weeks and I was so tired. Others have had differing experiences with how quickly they straighten up. The abdominal surgery is the worst bit. However, now I’m pleased I went for a diep as it looks so natural. I know there are many lovely ladies here who are quite happy with just having a mastectomy and going flat but I really couldn’t. I went on holiday this year and I was back in my bikini and feeling completely normal (and with now a very flat tummy). If you can and you want to have reconstruction do have the diep as it gives a great result. It is a big op and don’t expect to be running around normally for quite  awhile afterwards but life will go back to normal. i am awaiting nipple reconstruction and a bit of tweaking to the side.  Any questions please ask. Hope this helpsXxxxx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with High Grade DCIS

Posts.Content: The reconstruction takes about 4 months to settle after which they do any tweaking with the shape size etc I am having a bit of shaping to the side and my nipple reconstructed. You don’t have to have it if you don’t want to face further surgery. In a bra or bikini you can’t tell anything has happened to me. As far as my cosmetic team is concerned your nipple is reconstructed separately. When you have the diep the piece of skin taken from your tummy replaces your nipple and this is where they listen to make sure all is ok with the new boob. it does sound very daunting at this stage but take it one step at a time. You will get through it. Good luckXxxx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed with High Grade DCIS

Posts.Content: Wow!!! They look fab. Much appreciated for sharing. I’m going to have nipple reconstruction and then it will be tattooed. Your’s look really good. It’s really great to see other’s results it gives us all confidence.Xxxxx
Posts.Title: Permanent nipple tattoo with implant reconstruction

Posts.Content: I had a deip 10 months ago and last week had nipple reconstruction. So next will be a nipple tattoo so very interested in the experience advice re nipple tattoo from others. XXXXXxxxxx
Posts.Title: Breast tattoo

Posts.Content: Hi. I had an immediate reconstruction by DEIP on one side. it's a big operation , mine was about 6 hours and it's a slow recovery. It took me ages to straighten up. The abdominal surgery is quite significant and you will have a scar from hip to hip and a new tummy button. However, the results are amazing you end up with a new natural looking boob with a natural droop that is warm and soft to touch. I have had some lipo modelling and nipple recon and presently having nipple tattooing. If you can face the surgery - well it's more the recovery than the surgery, it's well worth it and I'm very pleased with the result. In underwear or in a bikini you can't tell the difference from the original except you now have a flat tummy!!!!
Posts.Title: Mastectomy and reconstruction advise

Posts.Content: I had my mastectomy and deip just before Xmas and one of the first things we did post op is book a holiday for early July, which I'm really looking forward to. Recovery from deip is long and slow but each day you get better and more back to normal....... I can't wait to go on holiday this summer after all the stress of the last few months!!!! And show off my new flat tummy!!!!! Things do improve.......XXXXxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Booked a holiday why am I tearful ?

Posts.Content: Hi If you are having an immediate reconstruction the surgeon needs a front opening support bra to put you in while still in theatre. You should wear it all the time for at least 6 weeks. Also good pair of support knickers are good to help with abdominal swelling and scar. I was advised (and bought) M&S sports bra with front zip - black one with pink edging and the front opening post surgery bra from House of Fraser website it has hooks and eyes. Both are comfortable. The hospital preferred the one with a zip for access-  at first on hourly basis. There are plenty others out there but was fairly lazy and bought what the hospital recommended. I bought strong support knickers from M&S.  Size wise your tummy will be smaller- surprise surprise - have gone down at least a size. I had to go and re buy smaller sizes.  Sports Bra- buy size larger than normal but you don’t need it huge as you need good support. I had 4 drains all went in without interfering with  clothing. I was only in hospital for a few days and used sports bra, hospital gown and ‘dressing gown’. Didn’t wear support knickers until I got home - could not do so in hospital as had 2 drains in abdomen. Hope that gives you some ideas....Xxxx
Posts.Title: Post operation underwear

Posts.Content: My surgery was just before Xmas so approx 8 weeks post op. They put a protective dressing on my abdominal wound and I certainly didn't catch it. It is difficult to say the correct size. I originally bought two sizes for myself in the supportive knickers and post surgery they were both far too big, and had to repurchase smaller again. They took every bit of fat from my stomach and then with the swelling I could hardly eat anything before I was full. I lost weight all over Xmas......only time ever. I had the same quandary with the bras. As far as the M &S sports bra was concerned, the fitter made an educated guess and it was fine. I went up a size on the band as not wearing it for sport. But, the sizing is tricky.
Posts.Title: Post operation underwear

Posts.Content: Hi I had mastectomy and reconstruction by DEIP just before Xmas. My tummy was so tight I was doubled in two. I could hardly eat as I was full easily and I felt as if somebody had put an elastic band round my stomach. (Well in way they had) I could only shuffle for very short distances bent double and as a result my lower back muscles hurt so much they made me scream in pain.  If I had to walk go to another room such as the bathroom, I  held onto somebody else's shoulders or waist to help take some of the strain.  I also had to walk up and down stairs sideways one step at a time all bent double like a little old lady. For the first week or so I slept with V pillow and other pillows At my back and 3 pillows under my knees. It's very uncomfortable. After a while I was then able to ditch the V pillow and used loads of pillows, then ditched the extra pillows and slept with just the pillows under my knees. I did the latter for quite a while. The first few weeks I thought things were never going to get better and I stooped for weeks. I also had to sit with my legs up on something higher. I was also very tired for months. But, please hang in there it does get better you do straighten up eventually but it does take a while.  Don't push yourself you have had a huge operation and not wishing to be too graphic a chunk of your tummy has been taken away and the two sides sewn back together again. At the moment at the stage you are 1 week post op the only advice is take the painkillers, rest and be patient. It is very very early days for you. When you can walk a little go for walks as this will help with blood flow and the healing process for you abdominal wound. I did find walking helped a lot.  I hope this has helped a little. I am now 10 months down the line and back to normal with a very flat tummy and dropped at least a dress size. All my old clothes are huge on me now!!!!!! Xxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Diep reconstruction - breathing discomfort

Posts.Content: I wasn't pleased I had to have one and the whole thing was a huge shock and very stressful. But, seeing as was in the situation I was in, I decided I wanted immediate reconstruction. I was also able to have an immediate deip which I was told was the best type to have especially as I was only having one side done. It certainly is very natural in feel and look - you can't tell in a bra. But, in my deip they moved the tissue to create the bulk and I will be having some shaping to the side and my nipple reconstructed later in the year. My tummy is amazingly flat!!!! Yes, it is worth the hassle and the results are very good. Good luck with your's but you really need to take it very easy post op.
Posts.Title: DIEP/TRAM Surgery - what to bring to hospital?

Posts.Content: I wore my very highly supportive spanks type knickers once home and still wearing them. Not to push fat in -as now have an amazingly flat fat free stomach - but they really help supporting with the abdominal scar.
Posts.Title: Post operation underwear

Posts.Content: Hi Angela 44 Gosh 3 weeks after..... you may be able but you will definitely have to take it very easy. Definitely no ‘living it up’ on the dance floor.  Recovery from deip is slow. I had an immediate diep and my surgery was 6-7 hours long. The anaesthetic, and the general stress and trauma of biopsies and results and shock etc in the immediate weeks prior to surgery, affected me for ages afterwards and I was very tired post op. You might be very different as yours is delayed reconstruction. The abdominal part of the surgery however can be a bit of a problem. I was unable to stand up anywhere near stright for over two weeks as everything was so tight. Post op is perfectly OK so long as you take it easy and don’t push yourself unnecessarily. I think the wedding may be a case of see how you are a few days beforehand as you do improve a great deal each week. Good luck. Xxxxxx
Posts.Title: DIEP/TRAM Surgery - what to bring to hospital?

Posts.Content: Great news!!! You are doing very well. Walking at snails pace is very good but don’t push things yet. You will stand very stooped for a while yet but you will straighten up. It just takes time. Each week from now you will improve in leaps and bounds and each week be able to do something new. Recovery from a diep is slow but very doable. You are doing great!!!!
Posts.Title: Diep reconstruction - breathing discomfort

Posts.Content: Just to say despite all the uncomfortness at the moment it is worth it!!! Each week is slightly better than the last and you do progress. In about 4 months time when everything had settled the results are amazing and you will have a very natural hanging new boob. However, there is no denying that recovering from the abdominal bit of the surgery is the worst part. Some ladies suffer more than others from this. I did suffer. Somebody on this site mentioned that those who had less fat suffered more. Not sure how true this is but all I know is i have absolutely no fat on my tummy now. Also it does all stretch out again. Again rest, take the pain killers, watch rubbish on TV and hang in there. Also when the time comes make sure you do all your exercises. The ones for the abdomen will help but you are not  able to do them yet. In a few weeks time. Can’t remember the exact time scale now. Xxxxxx
Posts.Title: Diep reconstruction - breathing discomfort

Posts.Content: Hi I had a deip just before Xmas. The hospital advised me to take in a front opening bra and gave me some suggestions: sports bra from M&S the black one with pink edging (comes in other colours) in a size larger than you would normally wear i.e. Not too tight - The fitters ther did help me on this. Or, the front opening post surgery bra from House of Fraser website it has hooks and eyes......Or something similar. I was lazy and bought what they suggested and they were fine. The bra was put on me during surgery and it needs to be front opening for access for the obs they will be doing hourly afterwards. I was also advised to buy some sort of support knickers not necessarily needed for when you are in hospital but to wear directly afterwards for support for your abdominal surgery. They help tremendously. I was in hospital for 4 days and had 3 or 4 drains so used the hospital gown, a 'dressing gown' and a pair of crocs for pushing on and shuffling a few steps in. The hospital gave me a nice pair of thick socks to wear but if they don't they could be useful if it's still cold.  Good luck with operation. It is a long surgery but the results are really good. Take all the pain killers and be kind to yourself afterwards it's a slow recovery but it's doable and you will improve. I hope all goes well.
Posts.Title: DIEP/TRAM Surgery - what to bring to hospital?

Posts.Content: Re control knickers - remember your tummy fat will no longer be there. After my DIEP I had to repurchase control knickers in a smaller size. Do try to wear them as they really help support, especially if the weather remains very cold. My long scar really doesn’t like the cold weather.
Posts.Title: DIEP/TRAM Surgery - what to bring to hospital?

Posts.Content: I had mastectomy and immediate reconstruction by diep (abdominal tissue) for some high grade DCIS. My op was around 7 hours, went without a hitch. Stayed in hospital for 4 days, v slowly shuffling out on pm of day 4.   I was bent double for weeks from abdominal surgery. It is a slow recovery but definitely worth the effort of doing. Result is so natural. But huge scary operation and I was petrified before hand. I will be having some tweaking on side snd nipple reconstruction. I am sitting in garden enjoying this lovely weather with bikini on and you wouldn’t know i had had any surgery.... also v v flat tummy. Gone down at least a size.... good luck with whatever you decide.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Choices....Any Thoughts?

Posts.Content: I had a diep just before Xmas and had had a C-section 16 years ago. I asked the question re C section prior to surgery and the surgeon said it was absolutely no problem. I had a CT scan but that was just to locate and plan which blood vessels they would use. All very routine for this operation. I can’t remember my BMI but you need a little bit of tummy fat for them to take. I think it needs to be more over 30 for there to be possible issues re the anaesthetic as such a long op.
Posts.Title: DIEP after C-Sections

Posts.Content: My reconstruction was an immediate Diep. Because I was having mastectomy done at the same time I was given priority and had a short wait. In fact, I could have had the operation earlier but they had to get a sental node biopsy fitted in first. I’m 6 weeks post op and I’m recovering fine. If you are able to have this kind of reconstruction and can cope with the recovery it is definitely the way to go.
Posts.Title: DIEP after C-Sections

Posts.Content: It depends on if any other treatment is needed and if so what etc your team will be able to advise on this. I had mastectomy and immediate reconstruction by diep, tissue taken from abdominal area, and it has been v successful. If you can have immediate reconstruction. It was a v long operation and they wouldn’t do anything to the other breast until the reconstruction had settled. But, not everyone can have immediate reconstruction for numerous reasons. You need to talk to both cosmetic surgeons and breast cancer consultant. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Advice on reconstructive surgery and reduction of good breast

Posts.Content: Hi Rosie75 i was diagnosed with 4.5 cm of high grade DCIS and was advised that I needed a single mastectomy. I had a SNB and modes were clear. After much thought and angst I decided to have immediate reconstruction by Diep. My op was just before Xmas so I’m 6/7 months post op. It was a huge surgery but all went without a hitch and I’m having some slight adjustment to the side and  nipple reconstruction when my name hits the top of the list, probably in the Autumn some time. My hospital said they automatically took the nipple away. In underwear or bikini I look just as I did before (if anything slimmer) and nobody can tell I’ve had surgery. The feeling of the new boob is quite natural with a natural droop but at the same it does feel slightly different to the other side. I can’t quite put my finger as to how to try to explain it to you. The worst bit is the abdominal surgery but mine is now healed and I have a very flat tummy. My new boob is a very good match to my other one so I’m not having done to the other side. Seeing I was in the position I was in, I certainly don’t regret having a deip. At the time however I was terrified and as you say not much info out there. I must admit there are now quite a few ladies on this site who have had teconstrtuve surgery. Diep is the best to have if you are able and can face it.  I hope this helps, just ask if anything else. It’s a big decision.Xxxxx
Posts.Title: Advice on reconstructive surgery and reduction of good breast

Posts.Content: Rosy75 i was petrified and confused with my head in a tail spin before my op trying to decide what to do. I’m not going to say a diep is a walk in the park as it’s not. It’s major surgery. But, the results are really good and you do get back to normal and nowadays I hardly think about it. Yes, there is light at the end of the terrifying tunnel!!!! And you will get through it!!!Xxxxx
Posts.Title: Advice on reconstructive surgery and reduction of good breast

Posts.Content: When using your own tissue you have a natural droop and the new boob will age with you so it’s more natural looking. Having said that this is much more important when you just have one side done. Also, mastectomy and implant as you say is a much smaller op as you say and recovery is much quicker. However, I was told at my consultation that implants can cause issues years down the line and if you are able they always recommend own tissue as although a bigger op there’s less after care. But you do need the tissue on your stomach this is particularly important for you for both sides to be done by diep. My surgeon came firmly down on side of diep if you can have it. But he did loads of them. Tricky one for you to decide..... Xxxxx
Posts.Title: Advice on reconstructive surgery and reduction of good breast

Posts.Content: I'm really sorry about you having to face this journey. I am at home at the moment recovering from the latest surgery regarding my breast reconstruction. I had a mastectomy and immediate reconstruction by DIEP last December which was a huge operation and I went round and round in circles as to whether it was going to be worth the discomfort etc Last week I had lipo modelling and nipple reconstruction and so I'm again feeling quite battered and bruised. However, I do realise you are thinking of an implant which is a much smaller operation and a much quicker recovery but it is still surgery. Having been through what I have had done I don't regret it one bit and extremely pleased with the results. Also, having a reconstructed boob makes you feel whole again, which really helps you own well being. I wanted to get on with my life and I felt that having one flat side would be a constant reminder of what had happened. That mastectomy scar is quite brutal and I wasn't sure I could deal with it very well. Also on a more practical level having reconstruction makes it not a problem to wear skimpy clothes or swimwear as you are not lopsided. I realise that this may be a bit of vanity but it did feed into my decision. On the other hand there are plenty of ladies who are more than happy to go flat and it doesn't impede on their life style at all. It's a very personal decision and you need to weigh up the pros and cons according to your own personal circumstances and what is right for you. I found hammering it out with somebody who knew me well was a good idea. My husband immediately told me i should have reconstruction as I would find it difficult to cope with the reminder of what had happened if I didn't. He knows me well and was absolutely right. I am glad I went through with it despite being petrified beforehand. For me the pros for reconstruction far outweighed the cons. I hope this has helped a little. Good luck with whatever you decide, it is a very personal choice and one that in the end you can make. XXXXXXXXxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Reconstruction or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Rosie75 I was out of action for quite a few weeks really due to the abdominal surgery as it was difficult to stand and walk about. But, each person seems to be different as far as this is concerned. I also seemed to be very tired after the op no doubt part of that was the effects of the anaesthetic but also due to all the tension that had built up prior to the op as things moved extremely quickly from a routine mammogram  to major surgery in a matter of a few weeks. My new boob has feeling and is warm just like you would expect but it does feel slightly different as the tissue is different.  I can now do everything as I did before. However, I am careful picking up heavy items if I have to twist my abdomin, it's not that I have been told this but I am a bit more careful. I asked the surgeon re reconstruction in the future if there were problems with the other side. He said they would use tissue from another part to reconstruct but the tummy tissue was the best to use as it was the most similar to breast tissue.   To be truthful I don't think about my new boob very much. (Indeed, my new boob is so much a part of me now that have been poking and prodding my boobs while writing this to answer your questions, much to some strange looks from my family!!!!) It's only when I'm in the shower etc that I remember about it as it's a bit fat on the side and there is no nipple - I am having both sorted. It also feels different whether that's because of the tissue or the tweaking that's needed I'm not sure and will only be able to answer once it's done.  But, now that I'm back in all my old underwire bras everything feels and looks the same.  Good luck in deciding what's best for you. It's not an easy or straightforward decision. Any more questions please ask as I'm happy to let you know my experience.XXXXXxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Advice on reconstructive surgery and reduction of good breast

Posts.Content: Hi I had a mastectomy and immediate reconstruction by diep (tissue taken from tummy). It was a big operation around 7 hours with a slow recovery, plus a hip to hip scar. It is the best reconstruction available at the moment but not everybody is suitable and not all hospitals offer it as there is some very clever microsurgery involved. The result however is very natural, soft and life like and you have a new boob that will age with you as it's your own tissue. I am going to have some tweaking re shape later on and have nipple reconstruction. Seeing as I had to have a mastectomy (I would have loved to have avoided it!!) I am pleased I went for this kind of reconstruction.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy tomorrow, trying to research reconstruction

Posts.Content: Brilliant!!! Thanks for sharingXXxxx
Posts.Title: Something I’d like to share

Posts.Content: I have just been told I have DCIS in my left breast and a mastectomy plus immediate r construction have been recommended. Went to see the plastics dept at St Thomas and they have suggested an immediate diep reconstruction and are keen to get on with it. Has anybody had any experience of this surgery at St Thomas' hospital or a deip reconstruction in general. Many thanks.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy and immediate reconstruction by diep at St Thomas' hospital...

Posts.Content: All you ladies have been so brave.  Everyone seems to think it is the best way to go. I don’t think I would like to go flat or have to wear a prosthetic but as you all know it’s such a big operation, and it’s all a bit daunting.  I’m so grateful for all your comments and support. It is really much appreciated. Xxx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy and immediate reconstruction by diep at St Thomas' hospital...

Posts.Content: Thank you for your comments. I am not looking forward to this operation but the plastic surgeons at St Thomas have said this is the best way to go. I justhope I do as well as the both of you.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy and immediate reconstruction by diep at St Thomas' hospital...

Posts.Content: Hi Nutmeg56 Thanks so much for the information. It is really very much appreciated. I'm really beginning to wonder what I have let myself in for...  In your opinion, was it all worth going through?
Posts.Title: Mastectomy and immediate reconstruction by diep at St Thomas' hospital...

Posts.Content: I had mastectomy and immediate reconstruction by diep just before Xmas. It’s a huge op and I was very apprensive. Spent 4 days in hospital then long slow recovery at home. I couldn’t walk properly for weeks and was really tired for ages after, all very normal after such surgery. Abdominal surgery is the worst bit. Results now amazing as you have a natural looking boob with a natural fall which will age with you. If you can have a diep and face the op and recovery, I think it’s the best reconstruction available at the moment. Seeing as I had to have a mastectomy I’m pleased I went down this route - although  it’s a big and scary thing to decide. I was petrified before hand and all over the place as to whether I was doing the right thing. All the surgeons - cancer surgeon and cosmetic surgeons all said If it were them they would do it.  As ruby rose has said you must do your exercises and massage scars. I have been using Bio oil.  Good luck and please ask if anything. Xxxxxxx
Posts.Title: reconstruction with abdominal fap

Posts.Content: You must go!!!!! I never had a lump I was lucky as mine was picked up on a routine mammogram. You must go only to reassure yourself it’s nothing. Anyway you have an appointment...... go - if it’s nothing that’s fine just s bit of time wasted. Good luck!!
